text: ਰਾਮਕਲੀ ਕੀ ਵਾਰ ਰਾਇ ਬਲਵੰਡਿ ਤਥਾ ਸਤੈ ਡੂਮਿ ਆਖੀ

translation.text: Vaar Of Raamkalee, Uttered By Satta And Balwand The Drummer:

transliteration.text: rāmakalī kī vār rāi balavand tathā satai dūm ākhī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satigur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਨਾਉ ਕਰਤਾ ਕਾਦਰੁ ਕਰੇ ਕਿਉ ਬੋਲੁ ਹੋਵੈ ਜੋਖੀਵਦੈ ॥

translation.text: One who chants the Name of the Almighty Creator - how can his words be judged?

transliteration.text: nāu karatā kādar karē kiu bōl hōvai jōkhīvadai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

author.author: Bhai Balwand and Satta
author.description: Bhai Balwand and Satta [15th - 16th Century], were brothers and Rebab players who played music for Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru, primarily in the Indian classical melody of Ramkali. Bhai Balwand, also known as Rai Balvand, was by birth a Mirasi, part of a community of genealogists for families in Northern India and Pakistan.

text: ਦੇ ਗੁਨਾ ਸਤਿ ਭੈਣ ਭਰਾਵ ਹੈ ਪਾਰੰਗਤਿ ਦਾਨੁ ਪੜੀਵਦੈ ॥

translation.text: His divine virtues are the true sisters and brothers; through them, the gift of supreme status is obtained.

transliteration.text: dē gunā sat bhain bharāv hai pārangat dān parīvadai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

translation.text: Nanak established the kingdom; He built the true fortress on the strongest foundations.

transliteration.text: nānak rāj chalāiā sach kōt satānī nīv dai .

text: ਲਹਣੇ ਧਰਿਓਨੁ ਛਤੁ ਸਿਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਿਫਤੀ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਪੀਵਦੈ ॥

translation.text: He installed the royal canopy over Lehna's head; chanting the Lord's Praises, He drank in the Ambrosial Nectar.

transliteration.text: lahanē dhariōn shat sir kar siphatī anmrit pīvadai .

text: ਮਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਆਤਮ ਦੇਵ ਦੀ ਖੜਗਿ ਜੋਰਿ ਪਰਾਕੁਇ ਜੀਅ ਦੈ ॥

translation.text: The Guru implanted the almighty sword of the Teachings to illuminate his soul.

transliteration.text: mat gur ātam dēv dī kharag jōr parākui jī dai .

text: ਗੁਰਿ ਚੇਲੇ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕੀਈ ਨਾਨਕਿ ਸਲਾਮਤਿ ਥੀਵਦੈ ॥

translation.text: The Guru bowed down to His disciple, while Nanak was still alive.

transliteration.text: gur chēlē raharās kīī nānak salāmat thīvadai .

text: ਸਹਿ ਟਿਕਾ ਦਿਤੋਸੁ ਜੀਵਦੈ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The King, while still alive, applied the ceremonial mark to his forehead. ||1||

transliteration.text: sah tikā ditōs jīvadai .1.

translation.text: Nanak proclaimed Lehna's succession - he earned it.

transliteration.text: lahanē dī phērāīai nānakā dōhī khatīai .

text: ਜੋਤਿ ਓਹਾ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਸਾਇ ਸਹਿ ਕਾਇਆ ਫੇਰਿ ਪਲਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: They shared the One Light and the same way; the King just changed His body.

transliteration.text: jōt ōhā jugat sāi sah kāiā phēr palatīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. translation.text: The immaculate canopy waves over Him, and He sits on the throne in the Guru's shop.

transliteration.text: jhulai s shat niranjanī mal takhat baithā gur hatīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਕਰਹਿ ਜਿ ਗੁਰ ਫੁਰਮਾਇਆ ਸਿਲ ਜੋਗੁ ਅਲੂਣੀ ਚਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: He does as the Guru commands; He tasted the tasteless stone of Yoga.

transliteration.text: karah j gur phuramāiā sil jōg alūnī chatīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਲੰਗਰੁ ਚਲੈ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦਿ ਹਰਿ ਤੋਟਿ ਨ ਆਵੀ ਖਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: The Langar - the Kitchen of the Guru's Shabad has been opened, and its supplies never run short.

transliteration.text: langar chalai gur sabad har tōt n āvī khatīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਖਰਚੇ ਦਿਤਿ ਖਸੰਮ ਦੀ ਆਪ ਖਹਦੀ ਖੈਰਿ ਦਬਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Whatever His Master gave, He spent; He distributed it all to be eaten.

transliteration.text: kharachē dit khasanm dī āp khahadī khair dabatīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਹੋਵੈ ਸਿਫਤਿ ਖਸੰਮ ਦੀ ਨੂਰੁ ਅਰਸਹੁ ਕੁਰਸਹੁ ਝਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: The Praises of the Master were sung, and the Divine Light descended from the heavens to the earth.

transliteration.text: hōvai siphat khasanm dī nūr arasah kurasah jhatīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਤੁਧੁ ਡਿਠੇ ਸਚੇ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਮਲੁ ਜਨਮ ਜਨਮ ਦੀ ਕਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Gazing upon You, O True King, the filth of countless past lives is washed away.

transliteration.text: tudh dithē sachē pātisāh mal janam janam dī katīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਸਚੁ ਜਿ ਗੁਰਿ ਫੁਰਮਾਇਆ ਕਿਉ ਏਦੂ ਬੋਲਹੁ ਹਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: The Guru gave the True Command; why should we hesitate to proclaim this?

transliteration.text: sach j gur phuramāiā kiu ēdū bōlah hatīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਪੁਤ੍ਰੀ ਕਉਲੁ ਨ ਪਾਲਿਓ ਕਰਿ ਪੀਰਹੁ ਕੰਨ੍ਹ ਮੁਰਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: His sons did not obey His Word; they turned their backs on Him as Guru.

transliteration.text: putrī kaul n pāliō kar pīrah kannh muratīai .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਦਿਲਿ ਖੋਟੈ ਆਕੀ ਫਿਰਨ੍ਹਿ ਬੰਨ੍ਹਿ ਭਾਰੁ ਉਚਾਇਨ੍ਹਿ ਛਟੀਐ ॥

translation.text: These evil-hearted ones became rebellious; they carry loads of sin on their backs.

transliteration.text: dil khōtai ākī phiranh bannh bhār uchāinh shatīai .

translation.text: Whatever the Guru said, Lehna did, and so he was installed on the throne.

transliteration.text: jin ākhī sōī karē jin kītī tinai thatīai .

text: ਕਉਣੁ ਹਾਰੇ ਕਿਨਿ ਉਵਟੀਐ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Who has lost, and who has won? ||2||

transliteration.text: kaun hārē kin uvatīai .2.

text: ਜਿਨਿ ਕੀਤੀ ਸੋ ਮੰਨਣਾ ਕੋ ਸਾਲੁ ਜਿਵਾਹੇ ਸਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: He who did the work, is accepted as Guru; so which is better - the thistle or the rice?

transliteration.text: jin kītī sō mannanā kō sāl jivāhē sālī .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. translation.text: The Righteous Judge of Dharma considered the arguments and made the decision.

transliteration.text: dharam rāi hai dēvatā lai galā karē dalālī .

translation.text: Whatever the True Guru says, the True Lord does; it comes to pass instantaneously.

transliteration.text: satigur ākhai sachā karē sā bāt hōvai darahālī .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਗੁਰ ਅੰਗਦ ਦੀ ਦੋਹੀ ਫਿਰੀ ਸਚੁ ਕਰਤੈ ਬੰਧਿ ਬਹਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: Guru Angad was proclaimed, and the True Creator confirmed it.

transliteration.text: gur angad dī dōhī phirī sach karatai bandh bahālī .

text: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਕਾਇਆ ਪਲਟੁ ਕਰਿ ਮਲਿ ਤਖਤੁ ਬੈਠਾ ਸੈ ਡਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: Nanak merely changed his body; He still sits on the throne, with hundreds of branches reaching out.

transliteration.text: nānak kāiā palat kar mal takhat baithā sai dālī .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

text: ਦਰੁ ਸੇਵੇ ਉਮਤਿ ਖੜੀ ਮਸਕਲੈ ਹੋਇ ਜੰਗਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: Standing at His door, His followers serve Him; by this service, their rust is scraped off.

transliteration.text: dar sēvē umat kharī masakalai hōi jangālī .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਦਰਿ ਦਰਵੇਸੁ ਖਸੰਮ ਦੈ ਨਾਇ ਸਚੈ ਬਾਣੀ ਲਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: He is the Dervish - the Saint, at the door of His Lord and Master; He loves the True Name, and the Bani of the Guru's Word.

transliteration.text: dar daravēs khasanm dai nāi sachai bānī lālī .

The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਬਲਵੰਡ ਖੀਵੀ ਨੇਕ ਜਨ ਜਿਸੁ ਬਹੁਤੀ ਛਾਉ ਪਤ੍ਰਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: Balwand says that Khivi, the Guru's wife, is a noble woman, who gives soothing, leafy shade to all.

transliteration.text: balavand khīvī nēk jan jis bahutī shāu patrālī .

text: ਲੰਗਰਿ ਦਉਲਤਿ ਵੰਡੀਐ ਰਸੁ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਖੀਰਿ ਘਿਆਲੀ ॥

translation.text: She distributes the bounty of the Guru's Langar; the kheer - the rice pudding and ghee, is like sweet ambrosia.

transliteration.text: langar daulat vandīai ras anmrit khīr ghiālī .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਗੁਰਸਿਖਾ ਕੇ ਮੁਖ ਉਜਲੇ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਥੀਏ ਪਰਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: The faces of the Guru's Sikhs are radiant and bright; the self-willed manmukhs are pale, like straw.

transliteration.text: gurasikhā kē mukh ujalē manamukh thīē parālī .

text: ਪਏ ਕਬੂਲੁ ਖਸੰਮ ਨਾਲਿ ਜਾਂ ਘਾਲ ਮਰਦੀ ਘਾਲੀ ॥

translation.text: The Master gave His approval, when Angad exerted Himself heroically.

transliteration.text: paē kabūl khasanm nāl jānh ghāl maradī ghālī .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਮਾਤਾ ਖੀਵੀ ਸਹੁ ਸੋਇ ਜਿਨਿ ਗੋਇ ਉਠਾਲੀ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Such is the Husband of mother Khivi; He sustains the world. ||3||

transliteration.text: mātā khīvī sah sōi jin gōi uthālī .3.

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਹੋਰਿਂਓ ਗੰਗ ਵਹਾਈਐ ਦੁਨਿਆਈ ਆਖੈ ਕਿ ਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: It is as if the Guru made the Ganges flow in the opposite direction, and the world wonders: what has he done?

transliteration.text: hōrinhō gang vahāīai duniāī ākhai k kiōn .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਨਾਨਕ ਈਸਰਿ ਜਗਨਾਥਿ ਉਚਹਦੀ ਵੈਣੁ ਵਿਰਿਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: Nanak, the Lord, the Lord of the World, spoke the words out loud.

transliteration.text: nānak īsar jaganāth uchahadī vain virikiōn .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਮਾਧਾਣਾ ਪਰਬਤੁ ਕਰਿ ਨੇਤ੍ਰਿ ਬਾਸਕੁ ਸਬਦਿ ਰਿੜਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: Making the mountain his churning stick, and the snake-king his churning string, He has churned the Word of the Shabad.

transliteration.text: mādhānā parabat kar nētr bāsak sabad rirakiōn .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਚਉਦਹ ਰਤਨ ਨਿਕਾਲਿਅਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਆਵਾ ਗਉਣੁ ਚਿਲਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: From it, He extracted the fourteen jewels, and illuminated the world.

transliteration.text: chaudah ratan nikālian kar āvā gaun chilakiōn .

text: ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਅਹਿ ਵੇਖਾਲੀਅਨੁ ਜਿਣਿ ਐਵਡ ਪਿਡ ਠਿਣਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: He revealed such creative power, and touched such greatness.

transliteration.text: kudarat ah vēkhālīan jin aivad pid thinakiōn .

text: ਲਹਣੇ ਧਰਿਓਨੁ ਛਤ੍ਰੁ ਸਿਰਿ ਅਸਮਾਨਿ ਕਿਆੜਾ ਛਿਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: He raised the royal canopy to wave over the head of Lehna, and raised His glory to the skies.

transliteration.text: lahanē dhariōn shatr sir asamān kiārā shikiōn .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਜੋਤਿ ਸਮਾਣੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਾਹਿ ਆਪੁ ਆਪੈ ਸੇਤੀ ਮਿਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: His Light merged into the Light, and He blended Him into Himself.

transliteration.text: jōt samānī jōt māh āp āpai sētī mikiōn .

text: ਸਿਖਾਂ ਪੁਤ੍ਰਾਂ ਘੋਖਿ ਕੈ ਸਭ ਉਮਤਿ ਵੇਖਹੁ ਜਿ ਕਿਓਨੁ ॥

translation.text: Guru Nanak tested His Sikhs and His sons, and everyone saw what happened.

transliteration.text: sikhānh putrānh ghōkh kai sabh umat vēkhah j kiōn .

text: ਜਾਂ ਸੁਧੋਸੁ ਤਾਂ ਲਹਣਾ ਟਿਕਿਓਨੁ ॥੪॥

translation.text: When Lehna alone was found to be pure, then He was set on the throne. ||4||

transliteration.text: jānh sudhōs tānh lahanā tikiōn .4.

translation.text: Then, the True Guru, the son of Pheru, came to dwell at Khadoor.

transliteration.text: phēr vasāiā phēruān satigur khādūr .

text: ਜਪੁ ਤਪੁ ਸੰਜਮੁ ਨਾਲਿ ਤੁਧੁ ਹੋਰੁ ਮੁਚੁ ਗਰੂਰੁ ॥

translation.text: Meditation, austerities and self-discipline rest with You, while the others are filled with excessive pride.

transliteration.text: jap tap sanjam nāl tudh hōr much garūr .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਲਬੁ ਵਿਣਾਹੇ ਮਾਣਸਾ ਜਿਉ ਪਾਣੀ ਬੂਰੁ ॥

translation.text: Greed ruins mankind, like the green algae in the water.

transliteration.text: lab vināhē mānasā jiu pānī būr .

translation.text: In the Guru's Court, the Divine Light shines in its creative power.

transliteration.text: varhiai daragah gurū kī kudaratī nūr .

translation.text: You are the cooling peace, whose depth cannot be found.

transliteration.text: jit s hāth n labhaī tūn ōh tharūr .

translation.text: You are overflowing with the nine treasures, and the treasure of the Naam, the Name of the Lord.

transliteration.text: nau nidh nām nidhān hai tudh vich bharapūr .

translation.text: Whoever slanders You will be totally ruined and destroyed.

transliteration.text: nindā tērī jō karē sō vanñai chūr .

text: ਨੇੜੈ ਦਿਸੈ ਮਾਤ ਲੋਕ ਤੁਧੁ ਸੁਝੈ ਦੂਰੁ ॥

translation.text: People of the world can see only what is near at hand, but You can see far beyond.

transliteration.text: nērai disai māt lōk tudh sujhai dūr .

author.author: Bhai Balwand and Satta
author.description: Bhai Balwand and Satta [15th - 16th Century], were brothers and Rebab players who played music for Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru, primarily in the Indian classical melody of Ramkali. Bhai Balwand, also known as Rai Balvand, was by birth a Mirasi, part of a community of genealogists for families in Northern India and Pakistan.

text: ਫੇਰਿ ਵਸਾਇਆ ਫੇਰੁਆਣਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰਿ ਖਾਡੂਰੁ ॥੫॥

translation.text: Then the True Guru, the son of Pheru, came to dwell at Khadoor. ||5||

transliteration.text: phēr vasāiā phēruān satigur khādūr .5.

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

text: ਜਿਨਿ ਬਾਸਕੁ ਨੇਤ੍ਰੈ ਘਤਿਆ ਕਰਿ ਨੇਹੀ ਤਾਣੁ ॥ ਜਿਨਿ ਸਮੁੰਦੁ ਵਿਰੋਲਿਆ ਕਰਿ ਮੇਰੁ ਮਧਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: He took the thousand-headed serpent as his churning string, and with the force of devotional love, he churned the ocean of the world with his churning stick, the Sumayr mountain.

transliteration.text: jin bāsak nētrai ghatiā kar nēhī tān . jin samund virōliā kar mēr madhān .

translation.text: He made intuition his horse, and chastity his saddle.

transliteration.text: ghōrā kītō sahaj dā jat kīō palān .

translation.text: He placed the arrow of the Lord's Praise in the bow of Truth.

transliteration.text: dhanakh charāiō sat dā jas handā bān .

text: ਕਲਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਧੂ ਅੰਧਾਰੁ ਸਾ ਚੜਿਆ ਰੈ ਭਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: In this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, there was only pitch darkness. Then, He rose like the sun to illuminate the darkness.

transliteration.text: kal vich dhū andhār sā chariā rai bhān .

text: ਸਤਹੁ ਖੇਤੁ ਜਮਾਇਓ ਸਤਹੁ ਛਾਵਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: He farms the field of Truth, and spreads out the canopy of Truth.

transliteration.text: satah khēt jamāiō satah shāvān .

text: ਨਿਤ ਰਸੋਈ ਤੇਰੀਐ ਘਿਉ ਮੈਦਾ ਖਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: Your kitchen always has ghee and flour to eat.

transliteration.text: nit rasōī tērīai ghiu maidā khān .

text: ਚਾਰੇ ਕੁੰਡਾਂ ਸੁਝੀਓਸੁ ਮਨ ਮਹਿ ਸਬਦੁ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: You understand the four corners of the universe; in your mind, the Word of the Shabad is approved and supreme.

transliteration.text: chārē kundānh sujhīōs man mah sabad paravān .

translation.text: You eliminate the comings and goings of reincarnation, and bestow the insignia of Your Glance of Grace.

transliteration.text: āvā gaun nivāriō kar nadar nīsān .

text: ਅਉਤਰਿਆ ਅਉਤਾਰੁ ਲੈ ਸੋ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸੁਜਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: You are the Avataar, the Incarnation of the all-knowing Primal Lord.

transliteration.text: autariā autār lai sō purakh sujān .

text: ਝਖੜਿ ਵਾਉ ਨ ਡੋਲਈ ਪਰਬਤੁ ਮੇਰਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: You are not pushed or shaken by the storm and the wind; you are like the Sumayr Mountain.

transliteration.text: jhakhar vāu n dōlaī parabat mērān .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਜਾਣੈ ਬਿਰਥਾ ਜੀਅ ਕੀ ਜਾਣੀ ਹੂ ਜਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: You know the inner state of the soul; You are the Knower of knowers.

transliteration.text: jānai birathā jī kī jānī hū jān .

text: ਕਿਆ ਸਾਲਾਹੀ ਸਚੇ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਜਾਂ ਤੂ ਸੁਘੜੁ ਸੁਜਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: How can I praise You, O True Supreme King, when You are so wise and all-knowing?

transliteration.text: kiā sālāhī sachē pātisāh jānh tū sughar sujān .

text: ਦਾਨੁ ਜਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਭਾਵਸੀ ਸੋ ਸਤੇ ਦਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: Those blessings granted by the Pleasure of the True Guru - please bless Satta with those gifts.

transliteration.text: dān j satigur bhāvasī sō satē dān .

translation.text: Seeing Nanak's canopy waving over Your head, everyone was astonished.

transliteration.text: nānak handā shatr sir umat hairān .

translation.text: Blessed, blessed is Guru Raam Daas; He who created You, has also exalted You.

transliteration.text: dhann dhann rāmadās gur jin siriā tinai savāriā .

translation.text: Perfect is Your miracle; the Creator Lord Himself has installed You on the throne.

transliteration.text: pūrī hōī karāmāt āp sirajanahārai dhāriā .

translation.text: The Sikhs and all the Congregation recognize You as the Supreme Lord God, and bow down to You.

transliteration.text: sikhī atai sangatī pārabraham kar namasakāriā .

translation.text: You are unchanging, unfathomable and immeasurable; You have no end or limitation.

transliteration.text: atal athāh atōl tū tērā ant n pārāvāriā .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. text: ਜਿਨ੍ਹੀ ਤੂੰ ਸੇਵਿਆ ਭਾਉ ਕਰਿ ਸੇ ਤੁਧੁ ਪਾਰਿ ਉਤਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: Those who serve You with love - You carry them across.

transliteration.text: jinhī tūn sēviā bhāu kar sē tudh pār utāriā .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. text: ਲਬੁ ਲੋਭੁ ਕਾਮੁ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੁ ਮੋਹੁ ਮਾਰਿ ਕਢੇ ਤੁਧੁ ਸਪਰਵਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: Greed, envy, sexual desire, anger and emotional attachment - You have beaten them and driven them out.

transliteration.text: lab lōbh kām krōdh mōh mār kadhē tudh saparavāriā .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

author.author: Bhai Balwand and Satta
author.description: Bhai Balwand and Satta [15th - 16th Century], were brothers and Rebab players who played music for Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru, primarily in the Indian classical melody of Ramkali. Bhai Balwand, also known as Rai Balvand, was by birth a Mirasi, part of a community of genealogists for families in Northern India and Pakistan.

text: ਧੰਨੁ ਸੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਥਾਨੁ ਹੈ ਸਚੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਪੈਸਕਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: Blessed is Your place, and True is Your magnificent glory.

transliteration.text: dhann s tērā thān hai sach tērā paisakāriā .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

text: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਤੂ ਲਹਣਾ ਤੂਹੈ ਗੁਰੁ ਅਮਰੁ ਤੂ ਵੀਚਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: You are Nanak, You are Angad, and You are Amar Daas; so do I recognize You.

transliteration.text: nānak tū lahanā tūhai gur amar tū vīchāriā .

melody.description: The emotions in Ramkali are like those of a wise teacher disciplining their student. The student is aware of the pain of learning, but is still conscious of the fact that ultimately it is for the best. In this way Ramkali conveys the change from all that we are familiar with, to something we are certain will be better.

text: ਗੁਰੁ ਡਿਠਾ ਤਾਂ ਮਨੁ ਸਾਧਾਰਿਆ ॥੭॥

translation.text: When I saw the Guru, then my mind was comforted and consoled. ||7||

transliteration.text: gur dithā tānh man sādhāriā .7.

text: ਚਾਰੇ ਜਾਗੇ ਚਹੁ ਜੁਗੀ ਪੰਚਾਇਣੁ ਆਪੇ ਹੋਆ ॥

translation.text: The four Gurus enlightened the four ages; the Lord Himself assumed the fifth form.

transliteration.text: chārē jāgē chah jugī panchāin āpē hōā .

text: ਆਪੀਨ੍ਹੈ ਆਪੁ ਸਾਜਿਓਨੁ ਆਪੇ ਹੀ ਥੰਮ੍ਹਿ ਖਲੋਆ ॥

translation.text: He created Himself, and He Himself is the supporting pillar.

transliteration.text: āpīnhai āp sājiōn āpē hī thanmh khalōā .

text: ਆਪੇ ਪਟੀ ਕਲਮ ਆਪਿ ਆਪਿ ਲਿਖਣਹਾਰਾ ਹੋਆ ॥

translation.text: He Himself is the paper, He Himself is the pen, and He Himself is the writer.

transliteration.text: āpē patī kalam āp āp likhanahārā hōā .

text: ਸਭ ਉਮਤਿ ਆਵਣ ਜਾਵਣੀ ਆਪੇ ਹੀ ਨਵਾ ਨਿਰੋਆ ॥

translation.text: All His followers come and go; He alone is fresh and new.

transliteration.text: sabh umat āvan jāvanī āpē hī navā nirōā .

text: ਤਖਤਿ ਬੈਠਾ ਅਰਜਨ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਕਾ ਖਿਵੈ ਚੰਦੋਆ ॥

translation.text: Guru Arjun sits on the throne; the royal canopy waves over the True Guru.

transliteration.text: takhat baithā arajan gurū satigur kā khivai chandōā .

text: ਉਗਵਣਹੁ ਤੈ ਆਥਵਣਹੁ ਚਹੁ ਚਕੀ ਕੀਅਨੁ ਲੋਆ ॥

translation.text: From east to west, He illuminates the four directions.

transliteration.text: ugavanah tai āthavanah chah chakī kīan lōā .

text: ਜਿਨ੍ਹੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਨ ਸੇਵਿਓ ਮਨਮੁਖਾ ਪਇਆ ਮੋਆ ॥

translation.text: Those self-willed manmukhs who do not serve the Guru die in shame.

transliteration.text: jinhī gurū n sēviō manamukhā paiā mōā .

text: ਦੂਣੀ ਚਉਣੀ ਕਰਾਮਾਤਿ ਸਚੇ ਕਾ ਸਚਾ ਢੋਆ ॥

translation.text: Your miracles increase two-fold, even four-fold; this is the True Lord's true blessing.

transliteration.text: dūnī chaunī karāmāt sachē kā sachā dhōā .
